title: get just fails since datalad-archives aren't no longer enabled by install

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
with #959 
on a repository which I initially got (with -n when I remembered that I should use some switch for a simple installation since install didn't work #998 )

``` shell
$> datalad install ///
2016-10-13 01:06:16,556 [INFO   ] Installing dataset at: /home/yoh/datasets.datalad.org 
1 installed item is available at
<Dataset path=/home/yoh/datasets.datalad.org>
(venv-tests) 2 18280.....................................:Thu 13 Oct 2016 01:06:16 AM EDT:.
hopa:~
$> datalad get -n datasets.datalad.org/openfmri/ds000001
2016-10-13 01:06:24,795 [INFO   ] Installing subdataset <Dataset path=/home/yoh/datasets.datalad.org/openfmri> in order to get /home/yoh/datasets.datalad.org/openfmri/ds000001 
2016-10-13 01:06:25,630 [INFO   ] Installing subdataset <Dataset path=/home/yoh/datasets.datalad.org/openfmri/ds000001> in order to get /home/yoh/datasets.datalad.org/openfmri/ds000001 
Tried to get 1 file. Got 1. 
/home/yoh/datasets.datalad.org/openfmri/ds000001 ... ok.
(venv-tests) 2 18281.....................................:Thu 13 Oct 2016 01:06:26 AM EDT:.

$> cd datasets.datalad.org/openfmri/ds000001

$> datalad get .

2016-10-13 01:06:36,024 [INFO   ] Actually getting 128 files 

Tried to get 128 files. Failed to get 128.
```
